intro: Casearia parvifolia var. genuina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved casearia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by orange-red berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
